page.title: 07THE PRESTON ARMY
page.content: Captain Robert Hinde inherited Hunsdon House,Preston,in 1754.The house stood on the site of Dinsley Castle,a 10th century stronghold.After his retire_ ment from the army in 1763 Captain Hinde settled in Preston and began to convert the mansion into a castle,com_ plete with turrets , portcullises and battlements.Guns guarded the entrance and fortifications were dug in the grounds.The house was renamed Preston Castle.Captain Hinde,the "General", dressed his 17 children and other village children in scarlet uniforms and would lead his "army" into Hitchin on special occasions,assembling in the market place.Captain Hinde died in 1786 and Preston Castle was never oc_ cupied again.It was demolished and only Castle Farm,north of the village, remains as a reminder of the "General"
